nl.joshuaslik.UFMReckoning.backend

Class Team

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.joshuaslik.UFMReckoning.backend.Team

  • public class Team
extends Object
    The Team Object stores all players in a given team. It divides them into active and bench players. The Object also keeps track of the team statistics.
    Author:
    Sander Benoist, Joshua Slik

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • addActivePlayer

        public void addActivePlayer(Player player)
        Adds a player to the Active Player list if the team has less than 11 active players and the player aint already in the list. When a goalkeeper is added, the method checks if the team doesn't already have an active goalkeeper. Also updates the team statistics.
        Parameters:
        player - is a Player Object

      • addBenchPlayer

        public void addBenchPlayer(Player player)
        Adds a player to the list of Bench Players if the player aint already in it.
        Parameters:
        player - is a Player Object.

      • checkActiveGoalkeeper

        public boolean checkActiveGoalkeeper()
        Checks if a team has an active goalkeeper.
        Returns:
        true when the team has an active goalkeeper,

      • removeActivePlayer

        public void removeActivePlayer(Player player)
        Removes a player from the Active Player list. Also updates the team statistics.
        Parameters:
        player - is a Player Object.

        public void removeBenchPlayer(Player player)
        Removes a player from the Bench Player list.
        Parameters:

      • removePlayer

        public void removePlayer(String id)
        Removes a player from this team, regardless of if he is a bench player or an active player
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the player to remove
